Package fr.uparis.beryllium

Class TerminalApplication

java.lang.Object
fr.uparis.beryllium.TerminalApplication
public class TerminalApplication extends Object
This class is the main entry point of the terminal mode application.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Parameters:
      args - No arguments are needed. Unicodes used for colors here: Red: "[31m" Green: "[32m" Blue: "[34m" Cyan: "[36m" Color resetting at the end of each string: "[0m"

      Parameters:
      choice - the string choice
      Returns:
      true if our choice is correct

    • chooseAStation

      private static ArrayList<Station> chooseAStation(Map m, ArrayList<Station> stations, Scanner scanner) throws QuitException
      Choose a station from a printed list of stations
      Parameters:
      m - the map we use for data
      stations - list of stations
      scanner - the scanner for terminal
      Returns:
      the station chosen
      Throws:
      QuitException

    • similar_names

      public static ArrayList<Station> similar_names(String name, ArrayList<Station> stations)
      This method is used to find stations that have similar names in case the user misspelled it
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the station to look for
      stations - The stations used in this app
      Returns:
      List of all the stations (with numbers to choose from) that have a similar name to name or nothing if no station was found

    • multi_choice_similar

      private static ArrayList<Station> multi_choice_similar(Map m, ArrayList<Station> possibilities, Scanner scanner) throws QuitException
      This method proposes every possibility found for a station name
      Parameters:
      m - The map used in this app
      possibilities - List of possibilities
      scanner - Same scanner for the whole app.
      Returns:
      Chosen Station
      Throws:
      QuitException

    • addStationByCoordonnees

      private static void addStationByCoordonnees(Scanner scanner, Map m, String name)
      Add a station with latitude and longitude
      Parameters:
      scanner - the scanner for terminal
      m - the Map
      name - the name of the station

    • findRoute

      private static void findRoute(Map m, ArrayList<Station> chosen_1, ArrayList<Station> chosen_2, boolean localpositionStart, boolean localpositionDest, int preference, Itinerary i)
      Find a route between two points
      Parameters:
      m - the map
      chosen_1 - the first station
      chosen_2 - the second station
      localpositionStart - if we start from a localisation and not from a station
      localpositionDest - if we're going to a localisation and not to a station
      preference - 0: shortest distance, 1: best time, 2: closest in the tree
      i - the itinerary

    • showPath

      private static String showPath(HashMap<Station,Line> res, LocalTime timeWeLeft, Itinerary itinerary)
      Show the shortest way to go from a station to another
      Parameters:
      res - result of the algorithm
      timeWeLeft - the time we left at
      itinerary - the itinerary that contains all the data we need (distances, times, etc...)
      Returns:
      a string of the stations and lines in order

      Parameters:

      QuitException

    • printSchedules

      private static void printSchedules(Map m, List<String> lineNames, ArrayList<Station> stations)
      Print all the schedules for a station and a line
      Parameters:
      m - the map
      lineNames - names of the line (because of variants it's a list)
      stations - stations we want the schedules
